instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short, can find from where the short. any idea?
was inject 10v but just what i touch with it getting hot..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message: <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> getting hot....need to replace? can be the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
"was inject 10v"
Not worth now, dead CPU!!!
So many times I explained why do not do this  :(.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short

You've just injected 6.5V on CPU VCORE...
